attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description: Physical stock counted compared to SAP inventory warehouse balances revealed variances as follows; Bread had -18.25 loaves, Yeast had +2.019 sachets while Polybags had -504 pieces. The rest of the stock items had minimal or zero variances.
attributes.recommendation:
•    Stock controls in place should be maintained to safeguard all stock items.
•    Some polybags varieties in the branch and not in use should be transferred to other branches.

value: •    We shall maintain stock controls to safeguard against any loss.

•    Control measures shall be maintained.
•    We shall transfer Nutri polybags to Forest branch as well as 1.5 white which are too many compared to branch production.
•    In prior audit, it was noted that Bread -7.5 loaves, Yeast +3 Sachets, Polybags +1562 pieces. The rest stocks items had zero or minimal variances

Stock take was conducted on 17th May 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.
There were minimal stock variations noted which implies adequate controls are in place
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description: •    From the samples picked, bread underweight were noted across all varieties as follows; 400g W – 20%, 1.5kg BT – 9%, 600g W – 36%, 800g W – 16% and 200g ML – 83%.
attributes.recommendation:
•    Underweight cases should be discouraged. The production team should ensure that standard production procedures are adhered to at all stages.
•    Random checks should be increased right from dividing table to packing.
attributes.effect:
•    The company is at risk of incurring penalties if underweight bread is detected in the market by Weights and Measures officials.
•    Supplying underweight bread can lead to consumer dissatisfaction.

value: •    We will continue to do random checks on bread production process at all stages to ensure we produce bread of the correct weight standards.
•    200g Mini loaf has just been re-introduced in the branch, we shall monitor the production to ensure there is weight compliance across all varieties.
•    In prior audit, bread underweight were noted as follows; 400g CT – 23%, 1500g W - 66%, 600g - 13%, and 800g W - 43%.

•    Bread weight check was done by selecting a sample from packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market. The aim was to establish whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.

•    The company is at risk of incurring penalties if underweight bread is detected in the market by Weights and Measures officials.
•    Supplying underweight bread can lead to consumer dissatisfaction.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that finished products meets the standard weight.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description: •    It was noted that production damages were averaging at 0.28% of the total production and market damages stood at 0.50% of the total sales.
attributes.recommendation: •    The management should ensure production damages are controlled to reduce the amount of revenue lost through excess damages.

value: •    The recorded damages level is partly attributed to oven breakdown.
•    Market damages are well controlled. We shall continue to emphasize that all bread production SOPs are observed to control high rate of production damages.
•    In the previous audit, it was noted that production damages were averaging at 0.32% of the production and market damages stood at 0.50% of the total sales.

•    Analysis of production and market damages was done for a period of 31 days from 16th April 2025 to 16th May 2025 to determine whether production and market damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% of the total production and 0.50% of the total sales respectively.

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description: •    It was noted that, Average production was 102.23 bags per day, which is 68% of the daily target of 150 bags. Yield achieved during the period was 192.24.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch should continue to adhere with production standards and also take advantage of the available production capacity.

value: •    We have been having a lot of shift cuts as we plan production depending on the orders. This means production capacity is not fully utilized
•    I commend our data clerks and the team for data accuracy. Production target shortfall is majorly as a result shift cuts. We have also transferred two mini-shops to forest.
•    In the previous audit, it was noted that average production was 110.96 bags, which is 74% of total target of 150 bags. Yield achieved was 192.21

•    An analysis of mixing chart summaries was done for a period of 31 days from 16th April 2025 to 16th May 2025, to confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow and SAP. Raw materials usage as per the set BOM, production yield and if the set production standards were achieved.

•    Production standards are adhered to as per mixing charts analysis, the branch's production capacity utilization was at 75% of the full available capacity. This indicates that the branch did not fully capitalize on economies of scale.
Operations/Production Department
To confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow and SAP. Raw materials usage as per the set BOM, production yield and if the set production standards were achieved.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description: •    Cash counted compared to cash flow balance had Kshs +2 variance
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch cashier should maintain the cash controls in place.
attributes.effect: •    Minimal cash variance implies that adequate cash controls are in place.

value: •    This is well noted
•    Well shall maintain the controls by undertaking regular random spot checks.
•    In the previous audit, Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.

•    Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 18th May 2025, to confirm whether cash held by the cashier matches the expected cash and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.
•    Minimal cash variance implies that adequate cash controls are in place.
Operations/Production Department
To confirm whether cash held by the cashier matches the expected cash and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description: •    Mini shop bread balance and sales proceed were properly accounted as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: •    The controls in place at the mini shop were found to be adequate and are operating effectively. It is recommended that these controls be maintained to ensure continued compliance and operational efficiency.
attributes.effect: •    The operations were carried out in accordance with the established standards

value: •    This is well noted. We shall maintain the controls.
•    We will maintain.
•    The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.
•    A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 17th May 2025 to assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
•    The operations were carried out in accordance with the established standards
Operations/Production Department
To assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description: •    It was noted that the production efficiency for the period was 4.37 bags per production worker.
attributes.recommendation: •    The controls in place on production workers should be tightened to eliminate inefficiency noted and also ensure production labour cost remains as per the projections.
attributes.effect: •    Efficiency shortfall implies that the company incurred unbudgeted production labour costs amounting to Kshs. 23,614.19

value: •    Production efficiency is affected by shift cuts. We will try and make sure those hired achieve the efficiency.
•    Branch manager is advised to ensure production workers hired achieve the standard production efficiency.

•    Production efficiency was calculated for period of 31 days from 16th April 2025 to 16th May 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired achieved the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.
•    Efficiency shortfall implies that the company incurred unbudgeted production labour costs amounting to Kshs. 23,614.19
Operations/Production Department
To ensure production workers achieve the desired efficiency.

attributes.title: Slicing efficiency
attributes.description: •    Analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 93.60 crates per slicer.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management should ensure packers hired are well controlled to eliminate any form of inefficiency.
attributes.effect: •    The Company set standard of 97 crates per slicer was not achieved implying that the branch hired 15 extra slicer at a cost of Kshs 13,680.

value: •    We are closely monitoring our slicers to ensure the 97 crates per slicer is achieved.

•    We have improved from the previous audit.
•    Branch supervisors are advised to ensure packing is managed well and that there are no mix-up of packed bread shift-wise.
•    In the prior audit, analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 87.93 crates per slicer.
•    Slicing efficiency was calculated over a 31-days period, from 16th April 2025 to 16th May 2025, to determine whether the KPI of 97 crates per slicer was being met.
•    Packing efficiency was not achieved implying that the branch hired 15 extra slicer at a cost of Kshs 13,680.
Operations/Production Department
To evaluate whether hired packers achieve the desired efficiency.

attributes.title: Vehicle Consumption Analysis
attributes.description: •    It was noted that all branch motor vehicles were consuming as per the set standards with minimal variations.
attributes.recommendation: •    Fuel consumption controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: •    Minimal variations is an indication of efficient fuel management.

value: •    This shall be maintained.
•    To be maintained.
•    Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis was done for the period 1st May 2025 to 17th May 2025, to evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
•    It was noted that all branch motor vehicles were consuming as per the set standards with minimal variations.
Transport/Fleet Department
To evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
